description: This ID card once belonged to a scientist.  The reverse side describes protocol for using it; this could grant access at one control panel, if you can find one.
This ID card once belonged to a military officer.  The reverse side describes protocol for using it; this could grant access at one control panel, if you can find one.
This ID card once belonged to a high level technician.  The reverse side describes protocol for using it; this could grant access at one control panel, if you can find one.
This is a visitor's pass.  The reverse side describes protocol for using it; this could grant one-time access to a card reader, if you can find one.
This is an employee badge for a maintence worker.  The reverse side describes protocol for using it; this could grant access to green zone card readers.

This is an employee badge for a freight hauler.  The reverse side describes protocol for using it; this could grant one-time access to a transport freight card reader.
This is an employee badge for a security professional.  The reverse side describes protocol for using it; this could grant access to yellow zone card readers.
This is an employee badge for a security professional.  The reverse side describes protocol for using it; this could grant access to magenta zone card readers.
